meaningMnemonic: If <radical>someone</radical> is holding <radical>flowers</radical>, they're probably an <kanji>author</kanji>. Authors really love flowers, because they help them think of flowery language they can use to sound smart in their books.
readingMnemonic: Unfortunately, the <kanji>author</kanji> is allergic to flowers. They are only allergic to touching them though, so the author is holding the flowers with a pair of <reading>cho</reading>psticks (ちょ), really close to their face. Using the chopsticks, they can still use the flowers to think of fancy, author-ly words without touching them.
